intro: Ternstroemia aneura, commonly known as the rough-stemmed ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Ternstroemia aneura is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
